creator: dan@dantanner.com
text:
I can fairly consistently get the BSOD on my win2000 machine using virtual 
hosts with both Tomcat 3.2.1 and Tomcat 4.0-beta.  (Despite it being a MS box, 
this is the first time I've gotten the BSOD with win2000.)

server-mode: standalone
port:80 (I didn't test if the problem also occurs on port 8080...I could if 
necessary.)
everything else was the default config.

I setup a virtual host which resided in my webapps directory.  The crash would 
happen fairly consistently (but not always) if I went to a page through the 
virtual host tunnel.  (Things worked fine if I manually set the address, e.g. 
http://localhost:80/foowebapp )

A BSoD is generally caused by device driver problems, not application 
problems.  It would be useful if this could be tested on a different hardware 
platform running Win2000 to see if the problem still occurs.
creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
It's either a VM or OS bug - nothing to do on tomcat ( we may try to hide the 
problem - but it'll be there and crash your system when you least expect it).
